info.description:
wargs
-----

wargs is a simple Python module to configure progam's arguments using
various methods. Currently, only configuration through environment
variables is supported.

You can get the values for several variables...
```````````````````````````````````````````````

.. code:: python

    from wargs.env import Loader

    NAMES = ['PATH', 'HOME']

    if __name__ == '__main__':
        loader = Loader(NAMES)
        config = loader.load()

        print(config)

If you execute that Python snippet, you will get an output similar to

.. code:: python

    {'PATH': '<value-of-PATH>', 'HOME': '<value-of-HOME>'}

It's so simple ;)

And transform some of them...
`````````````````````````````

.. code:: python

    from wargs.env import Loader

    NAMES = ['PATH', 'HOME', 'PWD']

    if __name__ == '__main__':
        loader = Loader(NAMES)
        loader.handle('PATH', lambda x: 'Heelo, Woorld!')
        config = loader.load()

        print(config)

You can run this snippet and take a look to the output :P
info.name: wargs
info.summary: Simple configuration of arguments to programs
